description: A large and complex settlement site that began in the late iron age, and continued into the Roman period with multiple enclosures and a large villa. By the 5th CE the villa was housing corndriers, and early Saxon graves cut into buildings. During the Roman period a bronze age barrow and cemetery was surrounded by a temenos, and has been interpreted as a shrine.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Stanwick (Northamptonshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Neal. “The Stanwick Villa, Northants: An Interim Report on the Excavations of 1984-88.” Britannia 20 (1989).
Raunds Area Project: Iron Age and Romano-British Project, 1995.
